p: Yet, answering these questions is challenging. This is because the analysis must be done as some patients are still hospitalized and their total duration in the hospital and final outcome are unknown. Second, the characteristics of hospitalized patients changed over time, as a result of both the dynamics of the disease and, later, the lockdown. Dedicated statistical procedures are required to account for unknown outcome or censoring in the data. Adjustment for confusion factors in estimating improvement in outcomes for COVID-19 patients, as well as in estimates on the sojourn durations in medical and ICU wards, is also needed.
